node.title: Matthew Wade comfortable T20 World Cup final could be last match for Australia
node.alt: An Australian batsman looks behind him to watch the ball go over the fence after a ramp shot.
node.description: Matthew Wade played as if his Australian career might have been over as he powered his country to a Twenty20 World Cup semi-final win over Pakistan. It's an approach he will now take into the final.
node.content: ["Matthew Wade says he thought he could be playing his last game for Australia before his heroics against Pakistan set up a Twenty20 World Cup final berth against New Zealand.", "In a double-sided showing of his complete transformation, Wade helped Australia stabilise from 5-96 before powering them home late alongside Marcus Stoinis.", "His final 33 runs came off just eight balls, with his three straight sixes sealing the win with an over to spare in a sign of how he has learnt to score fast outside of the powerplay in the lower order.", "But beyond that, Wade is an unlikely member of Australia's T20 squad.", "His days as an Australian player looked over when he was dropped before the 2017-18 Ashes, while he also went three years without an international T20.", "He managed to fight his way back into Australia's side as a specialist bat in all three formats, before recently falling out of the Test XI.", "And at age 33, Wade is now realistic that every series could be his last.", "\"I just wanted to do well and really wanted us to win this game, give us an opportunity to win the whole thing.", "\"[The final]\u00a0might be my last game too. As I've said in the past, I'm comfortable with it.", "Wade joked after Thursday night's win in Dubai that he had probably been dropped more than any other Australian player.", "But his run to form in the middle order should be enough to ensure he staves off the axe for another year and is part of Australia's home T20 World Cup campaign next year.", "With Australia's lack of finishers apparent, Wade entered this World Cup with a strike rate of 94.11 when batting outside the top four, compared to 145.12 in it.", "His rate of boundaries had also dropped from one in every\u00a0five balls to one in every 14 when batting fifth or below with no powerplay.", "But he has now won two games for Australia alongside Stoinis at number seven.", "Part of that has been his willingness to adapt, using ramp shots to open up the field and even winning the game with two of them on Thursday night.", "He has also taken up extra net sessions, training on optional days to make up for less time in the middle.", "\"It's confidence, I think,\" Wade said. \"Confidence in your ability to be able to finish the game.", "\"To be able to bat with Marcus has been awesome.", "\"And it's communication too. It's been a lot of fun, trying to keep calm [being] probably the biggest thing towards the back end.\"", "AAP"]
